Description: Pottery ostracon, two conjoining wall sherds from a wheel-made vessel in an orange ware. A brown painted inscription covers the whole of the exterior surface.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), Cathedral Central Terrace Church 2 (west of) Christian fill
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (395021) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/395021)
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
